words.english: Most nouns ending in -er are masculine
words.example: der Lehrer, der Computer, der Winter
words.example_translation: the teacher, the computer, the winter
words.rule: Nouns ending in -er are usually masculine

words.english: Male people and animals are masculine
words.example: der Mann, der Vater, der Hund (male)
words.example_translation: the man, the father, the dog (male)
words.rule: Biological males are grammatically masculine

words.example: der Montag, der Januar, der Winter
words.example_translation: Monday, January, winter
words.rule: Days of week, months, seasons are masculine

words.english: Car brands and alcoholic drinks are masculine
words.example: der BMW, der Wein, der Schnaps
words.example_translation: the BMW, the wine, the schnapps
words.rule: Car brands and alcoholic beverages are masculine

words.english: Many nouns ending in -e are feminine
words.example: die Blume, die Katze, die Schule
words.example_translation: the flower, the cat, the school
words.rule: Many -e ending nouns are feminine

words.english: Abstract nouns with these endings are feminine
words.example: die Wohnung, die Gesundheit, die Möglichkeit
words.example_translation: the apartment, the health, the possibility
words.rule: Nouns ending in -ung, -heit, -keit are always feminine

words.english: Female people and animals are feminine
words.example: die Frau, die Mutter, die Katze (female)
words.example_translation: the woman, the mother, the cat (female)
words.rule: Biological females are grammatically feminine

words.english: Numbers and tree names are feminine
words.example: die Eins, die Zwei, die Eiche, die Tanne
words.example_translation: the one, the two, the oak, the fir
words.rule: Numbers and most tree names are feminine
words.notes: Most tree names, some exceptions exist

words.example: das Mädchen, das Häuschen, das Kätzlein
words.example_translation: the girl, the little house, the little cat
words.rule: All diminutive forms are neuter

words.example: das Baby, das Kind, das Kalb
words.example_translation: the baby, the child, the calf
words.rule: Young beings are often neuter
words.notes: Not always true, but common pattern

words.english: Latin loanwords ending in -um are neuter
words.example: das Museum, das Zentrum, das Stadium
words.example_translation: the museum, the center, the stadium
words.rule: Words ending in -um are neuter

words.english: Colors and metals are usually neuter
words.example: das Rot, das Gold, das Silber
words.example_translation: the red, the gold, the silver
words.rule: Color names and metals are typically neuter
words.notes: When used as nouns, not adjectives

words.example: der Hund → die Hunde, das Jahr → die Jahre
words.example_translation: the dog → the dogs, the year → the years
words.rule: Many masculine and neuter nouns add -e

words.example: die Frau → die Frauen, der Herr → die Herren
words.example_translation: the woman → the women, the gentleman → the gentlemen
words.rule: Many feminine nouns and some masculine add -en
words.notes: Most common plural ending for feminines

words.example: das Kind → die Kinder, das Haus → die Häuser
words.example_translation: the child → the children, the house → the houses
words.rule: Many neuter nouns add -er, often with umlaut
words.notes: Always get umlaut if vowel allows

words.example: das Auto → die Autos, das Hotel → die Hotels
words.example_translation: the car → the cars, the hotel → the hotels
words.rule: Foreign words and some short words add -s

words.english: Some nouns don't change in plural
words.example: der Lehrer → die Lehrer, das Zimmer → die Zimmer
words.example_translation: the teacher → the teachers, the room → the rooms
words.rule: Masculine/neuter ending in -er, -el, -en often unchanged

words.example: der Vater → die Väter, die Mutter → die Mütter
words.example_translation: the father → the fathers, the mother → the mothers
words.rule: Some family words only get umlaut

words.example: der Mann → die Männer, das Museum → die Museen
words.example_translation: the man → the men, the museum → the museums
words.rule: Some plurals must be memorized individually

words.english: All plural nouns use 'die' as article
words.example: die Männer, die Frauen, die Kinder
words.example_translation: the men, the women, the children
words.rule: Regardless of singular gender, plurals always use 'die'
words.notes: Simplifies things - no gender in plural!

words.example: Eltern, Großeltern, Geschwister
words.example_translation: parents, grandparents, siblings
words.rule: Some family words only exist as plurals

words.example: die Hand → die Hände, das Auge → die Augen
words.example_translation: the hand → the hands, the eye → the eyes
words.rule: Body parts often get umlaut + ending

words.example: die Sprache → die Sprachen, das Fach → die Fächer
words.example_translation: the language → the languages, the subject → the subjects
words.rule: School subjects follow regular patterns

words.example: die Katze → die Katzen, der Hund → die Hunde
words.example_translation: the cat → the cats, the dog → the dogs
words.rule: Animals follow standard plural rules

words.example: ein großer Mann, eine schöne Frau, ein kleines Kind
words.example_translation: a tall man, a beautiful woman, a small child
words.rule: Indefinite articles change based on gender

words.example: der Tisch → die Tische, die Lampe → die Lampen
words.example_translation: the table → the tables, the lamp → the lamps
words.rule: Learn singular + plural as a unit
words.notes: Always memorize plurals with new nouns

words.example: zwei Katzen, drei Häuser, viele Leute
words.example_translation: two cats, three houses, many people
words.rule: Numbers above 1 require plural forms

words.example: Der Mann hat zwei Kinder. Die Kinder spielen.
words.example_translation: The man has two children. The children play.
words.rule: Use appropriate articles and plural forms
